feed.title: fqsss - lazy.nvim
feed.subtitle: Opinionated, modern, pretty, and clean Zola theme.

entry.title: My Neovim Setup with Lazy.nvim Plugin Manager
entry.content:
Neovim has become my go-to editor for everything from coding to writing LaTeX documents. I recently restructured my config using lazy.nvim, a fast, modern plugin manager written in Lua. In this post, I‚Äôll walk through how I organized my Neovim setup and how you can do the same.

üß± Project Structure

Here‚Äôs the directory structure of my ~/.config/nvim:

.
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ init.lua
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ lazy-lock.json
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ lua
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ plugins
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ai.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ autocompletion.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ autoformat.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ buffers-or-tabs.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ dap.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ filemanager.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ garbage-day.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ git.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ latex.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ lsp.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ mini.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ multicursors.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ plugins.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ rust.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ session.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ surround.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ telescope.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ theme.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ trouble.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ typst.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ui.lua
    ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ whichkey.lua
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ settings
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ init.lua

Setting Up init.lua

The init.lua file is the heart of a Neovim configuration. It‚Äôs the first thing Neovim loads, and in my setup, it handles:

  • global settings
  • bootstrapping the plugin manager (lazy.nvim)
  • custom UI tweaks

Load Global Settings

require("settings")

Bootstrap lazy.nvim

Before we load any plugins, we make sure the lazy.nvim plugin manager is installed:

local lazypath = vim.fn.stdpath("data") .. "/lazy/lazy.nvim"
if not (vim.uv or vim.loop).fs_stat(lazypath) then
  local lazyrepo = "https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim.git"
  local out = vim.fn.system({
    "git", "clone", "--filter=blob:none", "--branch=stable", lazyrepo, lazypath
  })
  if vim.v.shell_error ~= 0 then
    error("Error cloning lazy.nvim:\n" .. out)
  end
end
vim.opt.rtp:prepend(lazypath)

This block checks whether lazy.nvim exists in the expected path. If not, it clones the repository. That way, you can just git-clone your config and everything sets up automatically.

Load Plugins with Lazy.nvim

require("lazy").setup({
  { import = "plugins" },
}, {
  ui = {
    icons = vim.g.have_nerd_font and {} or {
      cmd = "‚åò",
      config = "üõ†",
      event = "üìÖ",
      ft = "üìÇ",
      init = "‚öô",
      keys = "üóù",
      plugin = "üîå",
      runtime = "üíª",
      require = "üåô",
      source = "üìÑ",
      start = "üöÄ",
      task = "üìå",
      lazy = "üí§ ",
    },
  },
})

Here, I import all plugins from lua/plugins/, and customize the UI icons shown by Lazy (especially handy if you‚Äôre not using Nerd Fonts). The icons make the plugin loading screen more expressive and readable.

Optional: Set Terminal Background to Match Neovim

local modified = false
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd({ "UIEnter", "ColorScheme" }, {
  callback = function()
    local normal = vim.api.nvim_get_hl(0, { name = "Normal" })
    if normal.bg then
      io.write(string.format("\027]11;#%06x\027\\", normal.bg))
      modified = true
    end
  end,
})

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("UILeave", {
  callback = function()
    if modified then
      io.write("\027]111\027\\")
    end
  end,
})

Global Settings (lua/settings/init.lua)

This is where I define my personal Neovim preferences ‚Äî everything from line numbers to key mappings. By isolating these in lua/settings/init.lua, I keep my init.lua clean and modular.

Let‚Äôs walk through what I‚Äôve customized. It‚Äôs self explanatory so I leave it to you

vim.g.mapleader = " "
vim.g.maplocalleader = " "

vim.opt.number = true            -- Absolute line numbers
vim.opt.relativenumber = false   -- I prefer absolute lines only
vim.opt.cursorline = false       -- Cursorline off to reduce visual noise
vim.opt.signcolumn = "yes"       -- Always show sign column
vim.opt.colorcolumn = "80"       -- Vertical ruler for code style
vim.opt.scrolloff = 4            -- Keep cursor centered with some margin
vim.opt.splitright = true
vim.opt.splitbelow = true
   
vim.g.have_nerd_font = true

vim.opt.mouse = "a"              -- Full mouse support
vim.opt.showmode = false         -- Hide "-- INSERT --", handled by statusline
vim.opt.clipboard = "unnamedplus" -- Share clipboard with OS

vim.opt.ignorecase = true
vim.opt.smartcase = true
vim.opt.hlsearch = true
vim.opt.inccommand = "split"

vim.opt.wrap = false
vim.opt.breakindent = true
vim.opt.smartindent = true
vim.opt.tabstop = 4
vim.opt.softtabstop = 4
vim.opt.shiftwidth = 4

vim.opt.updatetime = 250
vim.opt.timeoutlen = 300

vim.opt.undofile = true
vim.opt.undodir = os.getenv("HOME") .. "/.vim/undodir"
vim.opt.swapfile = false
vim.opt.backup = false

vim.opt.list = false
vim.opt.listchars = { tab = "¬ª ", trail = "¬∑", nbsp = "‚ê£", eol = "Û∞åë" }
vim.opt.guicursor = ""

vim.keymap.set("n", "<Esc><Esc>", "<cmd>nohlsearch<CR>")
vim.keymap.set("n", "<Esc>", "<cmd>noh<CR>")

vim.keymap.set("n", "<leader>q", vim.diagnostic.setloclist, { desc = "Open diagnostic [Q]uickfix list" })

vim.keymap.set({ "n", "i" }, "<C-s>", vim.cmd.w, { desc = "Save File" })
vim.keymap.set("n", "<leader>fs", vim.cmd.w, { desc = "Save File" })

vim.keymap.set("t", "<Esc><Esc>", "<C-\\><C-n>", { desc = "Exit terminal mode" })

vim.keymap.set("n", "<A-k>", ":m -2<CR>")
vim.keymap.set("n", "<A-j>", ":m +1<CR>")
vim.keymap.set("v", "<A-k>", ":m '<-2<CR>gv=gv")
vim.keymap.set("v", "<A-j>", ":m '>+1<CR>gv=gv")

Optional: Yank Highlighting

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("TextYankPost", {
  desc = "Highlight when yanking (copying) text",
  group = vim.api.nvim_create_augroup("kickstart-highlight-yank", { clear = true }),
  callback = function()
    vim.highlight.on_yank()
  end,
})
